TopicTitle: How long does it take to load your game?

Articles.Content:
This is a pointless thread. enjoy!

How long does it take to load the game? for me it takes about 3 mins. (I have quite a few mods installed)
a couple of seconds. No mods but alot of debris and flights going on. (it helps that i have it installed on my ssd ^^ )

I have a load of mods installed as I'm on steam and can't be bothered using a workaround to run multiple copies.

Takes about 5min

G.
uh....about 15 to 20 minutes >_> numerous mods and flights and stuff. Its a mess, but worth every minute
I have a good many mods installed, about 5 minutes on the laptop and 2/3 on PC.

This is a pointless thread. enjoy!

How long does it take to load the game? for me it takes about 3 mins. (I have quite a few mods installed)

I dunno. I just start it loading and then head out to the porch for a smoke. It's done by the time I get back.

Its worth buying a new pc and leaving the game running on that one to avoid load times

Edited May 9, 2013 by Stealth2668

About 5.5 minutes with the current setup. (limited mods installed)

53 seconds with a stock .19.1 install

Back when I used to have the nova punch pack installed in .18.2 with a few other mods it used to be about 23 minutes. A lot of the individual parts in that pack take a long time to load.

Now every time I add a large addon I try it first in my test install and find out exactly how much time it adds to a stock startup.
~41 seconds with about ten different mods installed. I wouldn't play this game if it took minutes to load.
About 3 minutes on an SSD. I am working on consolidating my mods now, takes too long!

Well,

Main loading to main screen: About 2 minutes, I try to keep mods to minimal.

VAB-Launchpad:

Old PC: 5 min first, 3 min next.

New PC: 5 seconds.

Over 500 parts, takes about 10 minutes.

I just alt-tab out and do something else while the game is loading. Hopefully 0.20 will optimize the process a bit.

I have too many mods which I never use, though.
Seems like about a minute. Not too bad. No mods installed.
Lots of mods and it takes 2:30. Used to take over 5 minutes (well over) before I upgraded to 12GB of RAM (from 4GB). Faster loading from VAB to launch pad too.

Usually between 2 and 3 minutes. I blame the mods I have installed. Some of them (particularly anything that was not optimized for 0.19 but still technically works with it) take a very long time indeed to load each part.
1 min 37 sec on a 7200 rpm HDD with ~15-20 mods installed.

About 1-2 minutes under Linux, 3 minutes under Windows (identical hardware -- dual-boot system). Which is really odd when you consider the Windows hard drive has a faster seek time than the Linux one -- literally the one aspect where their hardware differs, and Windows has the upper hand yet comes out on bottom!! (We won't talk about my laptop, where I really can't even fly ships in excess of 4 or 5 parts and yet I try to fly my 400-500-part ships on it anyway!!)

Only mod installed is Subassembly Loader. I do use symlinks and Dropbox to keep everything in sync between my various computers.
I'm using a relatively new PC (Feb. 2013) and some mods and I get loading times ~2 mins.
5~10 minutes on my laptop. I have KW, KSPX, and a lot of plugins.

3 seconds from a regular HDD. I have an Intel i5 and 8 Gb of RAM, but the only mods i like are Subassembly and Alarm Clock. That is loading a save game, main KSP takes around 10 seconds to load.

However the highest part counts i can lift without serious lag is about 300-400. The highest ever was ~700 and it was hideously slow until i dropped enough stages.

It's pretty meaningless though as the game is in alpha and un-optimised and all that. The main thing is that it's very stable and great fun to play.

Normally a minute or two.

A little longer right now, as I'm having a quick play while in the middle of an assignment.

3 seconds from a regular HDD. I have an Intel i5 and 8 Gb of RAM, but the only mods i like are Subassembly and Alarm Clock. That is loading a save game, main KSP takes around 10 seconds to load.

However the highest part counts i can lift without serious lag is about 300-400. The highest ever was ~700 and it was hideously slow until i dropped enough stages.

It's pretty meaningless though as the game is in alpha and un-optimised and all that. The main thing is that it's very stable and great fun to play.

It takes 10 seconds to load the full game? I somehow doubt that. The SQUAD splash screen is there for 7 seconds which would mean the rest would only take 3 seconds.

I just tested a vanilla install and it takes me 45 seconds to load on a 2.8GHz i5 with 12GB ram.

You're right. I timed it and it took 27 seconds. I exaggerated because it really felt like no time at all. Interesting you mention the logo, it was on for only 3s.

I have almost no programs running so i guess the system can devote more to KSP. The only active apps are driver utilities and firewall, nothing else.

About 20 seconds from the time I click on the shortcut, until I'm completely in game at the vab.

On a 1tb spinny Western Digital Black FAEX drive.
27 secs for a clean install. 1 min 30 secs with a 2.2GB KSP_win folder full of mods.
